messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Fwd:Education Empowerment Tax Credit, H.R.257
messages.msgSnippet: so according to this bill, we would be eligible for a $1000 per qualifying child tax credit for educational expenses incurred in homeschooling our children,
messages.messageBody:
so according to this bill, we would be eligible for a $1000 per qualifying child tax credit for educational expenses incurred in homeschooling our children, including computers and software? How much documentation is required? This bill is in committee right now. Has anyone heard further information? Of course if it is approved as a tax credit, you don't have to file for it.
Johanna
Life is the ultimate learning experience!
----- Original Message -----
From: ambersand
To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Thursday, April 26, 2001 4:59 AM
Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] Fwd:Education Empowerment Tax Credit, H.R.257


Has anyone heard of this? The info was sent to me by a local homeschool group list that I'm on. I am leary about any legislation that gets the schoolies/government more into our life and this seem like an opening for them to jump right in. I would also like the gov to stop taking so much money, not give it back to me like some gift I'm being rewarded with. Any comments or has anyone heard of this?

ambersand
--------------------------------------------------------------
Those of you who want to know more about this bill, can go to this website:

http://thomas.loc.gov/cgi-bin/query/z?c107:H.R.257:
<A HREF="http://thomas.loc.gov/cgi-bin/query/z?c107:H.R.257:">Tax Credit for Education</A>


Jennifer
